name: Narrator
dialogue: The bustling marketplace of Aethoria, filled with vibrant silks and exotic spices. Anya, a young seamstress, nervously adjusts her worn shawl, watching the charismatic merchant, Silas, bargain with a stern-faced noblewoman, Lady Beatrice.

name: Silas
dialogue: My Lady Beatrice: Surely such a discerning eye recognizes the unparalleled quality of this Sunstone silk! A mere twenty gold pieces is a pittance for such radiance!

name: Narrator
dialogue: Lady Beatrice scoffs, her diamond earrings glinting in the sunlight. Anya shrinks further into the crowd, clutching a simple linen dress she hopes to sell.

name: Beatrice
dialogue: You insult my intelligence, Silas. This silk is faded, the dye uneven. Fifteen, and not a copper more.

name: Narrator
dialogue: Silas throws his hands up in mock despair, his jovial facade cracking slightly. Anya, seeing an opportunity, steps forward hesitantly.

name: Anya
dialogue: Forgive my intrusion, my Lady, but I have a simple linen dress, strong and well-stitched. Perhaps it would suit a lady of your station for everyday wear?

name: Narrator
dialogue: Lady Beatrice turns, her gaze sweeping over Anya with disdain, then lingering on the dress. A flicker of something unreadable crosses her face.
